courses.description: This course is designed to develop basic knowledgebase in infectious diseases in the society, in contexts of causation, impacts, diagnosis and epidemiology.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health

courses.subject: INFD
courses.title: Topics in Infection and Microbiology I
courses.description: This course is designed to strengthen knowledge in microbiology and infectious diseases in public health contexts.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health

courses.subject: INFD
courses.title: Infectious Diseases of Public Health Importance: Epidemiology, Control and Policy
courses.description: This course is designed to strengthen knowledge in microbiology and infectious diseases in public health contexts
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students under School of Public Health

courses.subject: INFD
courses.title: Infection Control in Health Care and Community Settings

meetings.instructor: Dr. CHEN Hong,   Professor CHOI Kin Wing,   Professor FUNG Sau Chun Kitty,   Professor NG Ho Leung,   Professor YUNG Wai Hung Raymond
Dr. CHEN Hong,   Professor CHOI Kin Wing,   Professor FUNG Sau Chun Kitty,   Professor NG Ho Leung,   Professor YUNG Wai Hung Raymond

courses.description: Students would be introduced to the principles and practice of infection control in three settingsâ€“hospital and clinic, laboratory and the community, through a series of lectures tailored to the needs of public health professionals. The emphasis would be on the development of a systematic approach to infection control practice.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health

courses.subject: INFD
courses.title: Surveillance / Outbreak Investigation / Control
courses.description: Students learn to apply the science of epidemiology to solve practical real life problems related to the surveillance and outbreaks of infectious diseases
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health

courses.subject: INFD
courses.title: Applied Epidemiology: Outbreak Investigation
courses.description: This course is designed to consolidate the knowledge base in infectious diseases epidemiology for application in public health practice.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health

courses.subject: INFD
courses.title: Application of Geographic Information System in Public Health

meetings.instructor: Dr. WONG Kwan Kit,   Professor LEE Shui Shan,   Professor WONG Ngai Sze

courses.description: "Geographical information system (GIS), integrating cartography, statistical analysis, and database technology, has been widely applied in the study of public health, for example, disease surveillance, risk assessment, and decision making for public health practices. This course aims to offer a general introduction to GIS, including basic concepts, methodologies, and applications of GIS in public health issues.No special prerequisite for this course. Class size can NOT be larger than 40."
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health

courses.subject: INFD
courses.title: Public Health and Infectious Disease

meetings.instructor: Professor MOK Ka Pun,   Professor TUN Hein Min
Professor MOK Ka Pun,   Professor TUN Hein Min

courses.description: This course aims to bridge virological and bacteriological concepts with laboratory-based public health practices, focusing on the impact of infectious diseases.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health

courses.subject: INFD
courses.title: Major and Neglected Tropical Infectious Diseases of Poverty
courses.description: Introduction to the major tropical infectious diseases and neglected tropical diseases (NTD) of poverty, as well as the current control strategies at the global and regional levels
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg student under School of Public Health: - Master of Public Health;- MSc/PgD in Epidemiology & Biostatistics; - MSc/PgD in Health Services Management;- PgD in Public Health

courses.subject: INFD
courses.title: Introduction of Bioinformatics
courses.description: This course intends to provide an overview of the bioinformatics analyses for health management and epidemiological studies. Content of this course includes to examine the current knowledge and strategy for managing information of patient- and pathogen-specific covariates and genetic information to understand disease progression or host-pathogen interaction. Key issues in i) Genetic Association Studies, ii) Network Analysis, iii) Deep Sequencing Applications and iv) Phylogenetic Analysis will be addressed in this course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students under School of Public Health

courses.subject: INFD
courses.title: Practicum on Infectious Diseases
courses.description: The course offers a learning opportunity to students who are interested in the public health control of infectious diseases in the local context. In addition to learning about the work of the Centre for Health Protection (CHP), Department of Health, the Module coordinator would guide students with discussion and tutorial.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health
